oai_dc:dc.dc:title: List of guns received and forwarded from 124th Regiment, Tennessee Militia

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: List of the guns received for the 124th Regiment, Tennessee Militia, Bolivar, Tennessee, to Memphis. The document lists 176 citizens and the value of each donated firearm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This list was probably created in response to Governor's General Order No. 1. General orders are published directives issued by a commander, binding upon all personnel under his command to affect policies or procedures unique to a unit's situation not addressed by service regulations. General orders have the force of law within the unit where they are issued. This order involves the requisition and assessment of private arms for military use.
